translation.en: ♪ Let's go to Rhyme Time Town ♪
♪ So many, so many friends to see ♪
♪ I can't wait till you're here with me ♪
♪ Daisy's coming and Cole is, too ♪
translation.de: Daisy und Cole sind mit dabei!

translation.en: ♪ Come on, let's go to Rhyme Time ♪
♪ Everybody, let's go to Rhyme Time ♪
♪ Come on, let's go to Rhyme Time Town ♪
-♪ Come on, let's go to Rhyme Time Town ♪ -[both giggling]
Our ring of roses is almost done.
Mayor Spoon will be so happy with the town square.
translation.de: Bürgermeisterin Löffel wird sehr zufrieden sein.

translation.en: Being in your helping club is awesome!
translation.de: Es ist toll, in deinem Helfer-Club zu sein!

translation.en: This looks even lovelier than I thought it would.
translation.de: Das sieht noch besser aus, als ich dachte.

translation.en: [all] We're the Hickory Helpers, and we're here to help you!
translation.de: Wir sind Hickorys Helfer, und wir helfen gern!

translation.en: There's something else you can help me with if you'd like.
translation.de: Ihr könnt noch mit etwas anderem helfen.

translation.en: There's a whole field full of roses over on the farm.
translation.de: Auf der Farm ist ein Feld voller Rosen.

translation.en: Could you please put them all into pots
and make more rings of roses round the square?
Yeah! We'd love to do that.
We'll head to the farm right away.
We'll make the square really pretty.
And we'll be helping everyone in town.
We're taking all the roses into town, remember?
translation.de: Wir bringen die Rosen in die Stadt.

translation.en: Why don't we ask Jaime to be a Hickory Helper?
Maybe she can help us move the roses.
Can you help us bring these roses to the town square?
translation.de: Hilfst du beim Transport der Rosen?

translation.en: We're helping Mayor Spoon because we're Hickory Helpers.
translation.de: Wir helfen Bürgermeisterin Löffel als Hickorys Helfer.
Huch! Ich versuche es noch mal.

translation.en: She's caught a really bad cold.
Yeah. I wish we could help her feel better.
translation.de: Ja. Könnten wir ihr nur helfen!

translation.en: We can. Let's do it, Hickory Helpers!
translation.de: Das können wir. Tun wir es, Hickorys Helfer!

translation.en: They always cheer people up when they're sick.
Let's take some flowers to Jaime.
But what about the rings of roses in the town square?
translation.de: Und die Rosen-Ringe für den Stadtplatz?

translation.en: You go and see Jaime, and we'll take the flowers to the town square.
translation.de: Ihr geht zu Jamie und wir zum Stadtplatz.

translation.en: Jaime, we've come to help you feel better.
I feel fine now. Not a single sneeze.
translation.de: Jetzt geht es mir gut. Ich niese nicht mehr.

translation.en: These are for you, to help you feel even better.
translation.de: Für dich, damit es dir noch besser geht.

translation.en: We have to help her some more.
Hi there, Jaime. Are you feeling better now?
translation.de: Hi, Jamie. Geht es dir jetzt besser?

translation.en: This is the strangest cold I've ever had--
translation.de: So eine seltsame Erkältung hatte ich noch nie...

translation.en: ♪ Ring around the rosie Lots of pretty posies ♪
translation.de: Ringel Rangel Rose Viele schöne Sträuße

translation.en: ♪ Here, there, everywhere In Rhyme Time Town ♪
translation.de: Hier, da und überall In Kleinreimstadt

translation.en: Aw, we haven't helped Jaime one bit.
Come on, guys. Hickory Helpers never give up.
translation.de: Kommt. Hickorys Helfer geben nie auf.

translation.en: But, oh, my clicking clockwork, she's one sneezy train today.
translation.de: Aber, oh, mein uriges Uhrwerk, sie niest wirklich viel.

translation.en: [gasps] I know! A "get well soon" card.
Yeah! A really massive one 'cause her sneezes are so big.
translation.de: Ja! Eine riesengroße, weil ihre Nieser so gewaltig sind.

translation.en: We can all make it together. Let's go.
Actually, Jack and I have another idea that might help Jaime.
translation.de: Jack und ich haben noch eine Idee.

translation.en: We'll see you at the station soon. Bye, guys.
translation.de: Wir sehen uns bald am Bahnhof. Bis dann.

translation.en: This'll make Jaime feel better for sure.
Is that for me? It's beautiful.
-And I'm all better now. -Wow, that was fast.
translation.de: -Und es geht mir besser. -Das ging aber schnell!

translation.en: Just seeing it has made Jaime feel not sneezy.
translation.de: Und schon muss Jamie nicht mehr niesen.

translation.en: It'll look so good in my station.
translation.de: Am Bahnhof wird sie gut aussehen.

translation.en: This is great! Go, Jaime, go!
I wonder why your sneezes keep coming and going.
translation.de: Mal niest du und mal nicht. Warum?

translation.en: [laughs] I don't know. No lo sé.
translation.de: Ich weiß es nicht. No lo sé.

translation.en: Poor Jaime. She's sneezed herself right out of town.
translation.de: Arme Jamie. Sie hat sich aus der Stadt geniest.

translation.en: But that's funny, I'm not sneezy at all now.
translation.de: Es ist komisch, jetzt muss ich nicht niesen.

translation.en: Uh-oh. I know how this ends.
translation.de: Oh, oh. Ich weiß, wie das endet.

translation.en: With a great big "we all fall down."
-I think I've figured it out. -Me, too!
I think the roses are making Jaime sneeze.
translation.de: Ich glaube, es sind die Rosen.

translation.en: [gasps] Oh, no, we put them all over town!
translation.de: Oh nein. Wir haben sie überall gepflanzt!

translation.en: There are rings of roses everywhere!
And we covered Jaime's station in them.
So Jaime can never go home again?
translation.de: Kann Jamie nie mehr nach Hause?

translation.en: and put the roses somewhere far away from Jaime's tracks.
translation.de: Wir platzieren die Rosen weit weg von Jamies Gleisen.

translation.en: How about the hill behind Jack and Jill's workshop?
translation.de: Wie wär's mit dem Hügel bei Jack und Jill?

translation.en: My tracks don't go up there.
And you helped everyone in town.
That hillside rose garden you made is beautiful!
translation.de: Euer Rosengarten am Hügel ist wunderschön!

translation.en: And as a special thank-you for being such fantastic Hickory Helpers...
translation.de: Und zum Dank dafür, dass ihr so fantastische Helfer seid...

translation.en: [all] We're the Hickory Helpers, and we're here to help you!
translation.de: Wir sind Hickorys Helfer, und wir helfen gern!

translation.en: There's a surprise for you at your station.
To help you have a flowery station that won't make you sneeze.
translation.de: Damit du einen Blumen-Bahnhof hast, von dem du nicht niest.

translation.en: for letting us have our own café right next to your diner.
translation.de: dass wir neben eurem Lokal ein Café haben dürfen.

translation.en: Can you please find the cream cheese and pineapples?
translation.de: Such den Frischkäse und die Ananas.

translation.en: And could you find a tomato for my tomato and spinach flan, Chef Cole?
translation.de: Suchst du eine Tomate für die Tomaten-Spinat-Quiche, Koch Cole?

translation.en: You two are so good at finding things to go into the yummy food we're making.
translation.de: Ihr seid gut darin, Zutaten für das leckere Essen zu finden.

translation.en: When do we get to lick the cheesy spoons?
translation.de: Wann dürfen wir die Löffel ablecken?

translation.en: Oh, look, it'll be lunchtime soon.
We've gotta set up the Daisy-Cole Café.
decide what the special dessert of the day will be.
We'll make whatever dessert you would love the most,
to thank you for helping us be chefs.
translation.de: weil ihr uns helft, Köche zu sein.

translation.en: Hmm, well, you know what the best dessert would be for a lovely sunny day like this?
translation.de: Wisst ihr, was das beste Dessert für so einen sonnigen Tag wäre?
Ach, wenn wir das nur könnten.

translation.en: [sighs] But we haven't made Mulberry Delight since we were kids.
translation.de: Wir haben es seit der Kindheit nicht gemacht.

translation.en: We've never found a mulberry bush.
We've looked up and down, and high and low,
and all over Rhyme Time Town.
But we never found a single mulberry.
Why don't we look for some?
Then Mulberry Delight can be the special dessert of the day.
translation.de: Dann wird der Maulbeer-Traum das Tagesdessert.

translation.en: We're super great at finding things.
translation.de: Wir sind sehr gut im Suchen.

translation.en: -♪ Polly, put the kettle on ♪ -♪ We'll all have tea ♪
translation.de: -Polly, setz das Wasser auf -Wir trinken Tee

translation.en: -Hello! What are you guys up to? -[panting]
and make a special Mulberry Delight dessert for everyone.
translation.de: um ein Maulbeerdessert für alle zu machen.

translation.en: It's kind of a berry, I guess.
translation.de: Es ist wohl eine Art Beere.

translation.en: We've been making a café in town.
It's called "The Daisy and Cole Café."
-Where is it? -It's over by the diner.
Oh! Do we get to eat there?
And 'cause you're helping, maybe you'll get to lick the mixing spoons.
translation.de: Vielleicht dürft ihr sogar die Löffel ablecken.

translation.en: -What do you think? -[Humpty] Way ahead of you.
translation.de: Was meinst du? Ich weiß schon.

translation.en: Come on, let's get to the Daisy-Cole-Humpty-Mary-Mary-Café.
Hi, Chuckley. Could you help us, please?
We're chefs, and we want to make Mulberry Delight for Polly and Molly,
translation.de: Wir sind Köche und wollen einen Maulbeer-Traum machen,

translation.en: but we don't really know what mulberries are.
translation.de: wissen aber nicht genau, was Maulbeeren sind.

translation.en: Or what a mulberry bush looks like.
Hmm. Neither do I, but that's no problem.
I'll just check out my big book of fruit and veggies.
they smell a bit sour, and they're soft, but not squishy.
translation.de: sie riechen etwas sauer und sind weich, aber nicht matschig.

translation.en: A mulberry bush has oval leaves shaped like this."
-Great! Will you help us find some? -[chuckles]
translation.de: Prima! Hilfst du uns, welche zu finden?

translation.en: A kind of fruit I've never seen before? Just try and stop me!
translation.de: Eine Frucht, die ich nie gesehen habe? Klar!

translation.en: ♪ We're off to find a mulberry bush Mulberry bush, mulberry bush ♪
translation.de: Wir suchen einen Maulbeerstrauch Maulbeerstrauch, Maulbeerstrauch

translation.en: ♪ We're off to find a mulberry bush On a warm and sunny morning ♪
translation.de: Wir suchen einen Maulbeerstrauch Am warmen, sonnigen Morgen

translation.en: -[birds chirping] -Everything we need for Mulberry Delight.
translation.de: Alles, was fürs Dessert nötig ist.

translation.en: Apart from the mulberries, of course!
Great job setting up the café.
Did you decide where to put the mixing table yet?
translation.de: Wisst ihr, wohin mit dem Tisch?

translation.en: where everyone can see the chefs at work.
translation.de: wo jeder die Köche bei der Arbeit sehen kann.
Nein, da drüben ist es besser.

translation.en: Hmm, nah. Back there was better.
translation.de: Nein. Dahinten war es doch besser.

translation.en: Don't touch anything until I've checked it and made sure it's safe.
translation.de: Fasst nichts an, bis ich es nachgeschlagen habe.

translation.en: Do these berries look like the mulberries in the book?
translation.de: Sehen die aus wie die Maulbeeren im Buch?

translation.en: I don't think they are mulberries.
The book said mulberries smell sour.
That's some good sniffing, Chef Daisy.
Where does your nose want us to try next?
♪ We're off to find a mulberry bush Mulberry bush, mulberry bush ♪
translation.de: Wir suchen einen Maulbeerstrauch Maulbeerstrauch, Maulbeerstrauch

translation.en: ♪ We're off to find a mulberry bush On a warm and sunny morning ♪
translation.de: Wir suchen einen Maulbeerstrauch Am warmen, sonnigen Morgen

translation.en: We're on the hunt for mulberries. Got any growing in your orchard?
Oh, I don't think so. They're really rare.
translation.de: Ich glaube nicht. Sie sind äußerst selten.

translation.en: -You're welcome to look around, though. -Thanks, Lucy.

translation.de: Hey, was ist mit der hier?

translation.en: Smells just right-- a little bit sour.
translation.de: Sie riecht genau richtig: etwas sauer.

translation.en: Uh, but it's not the right shape.
Oh, yeah, not purplish red like in the book.
translation.de: Oh ja, nicht blaurot, wie in dem Buch.

translation.en: [sighs] I really wanted these to be mulberries.
Me, too. And it'll be lunchtime soon.
translation.de: Ich auch. Und bald ist Mittagszeit.

translation.en: I don't have any purplish-red berries at all.
But there are all sorts of berries growing in the Cradle Tree Woods.
translation.de: Aber im Wiegenbaumwald wachsen ganz viele Beeren.

translation.en: ♪ We're off to find a mulberry bush Mulberry bush, mulberry bush ♪
translation.de: Wir suchen einen Maulbeerstrauch Maulbeerstrauch, Maulbeerstrauch

translation.en: ♪ We're off to find a mulberry bush On a warm and sunny morning ♪
translation.de: Wir suchen einen Maulbeerstrauch Am warmen, sonnigen Morgen

translation.en: I wonder if we'll have the dessert of the day ready in time.
translation.de: Ob das Tagesdessert rechtzeitig fertig wird?

translation.en: Ready to practice roller-serving, waiter Mary Mary?
-[Humpty wailing] -[Mary Mary] Oh! Aah, look out!
Over here. These berries smell a bit sour.
Let me just check that they're soft, but not squishy.
translation.de: Sind sie weich, aber nicht matschig?

translation.en: What are all the things we know about mulberry bushes?
translation.de: Was wissen wir alles über Maulbeersträuche?

translation.en: And the leaves on the bush are...
Uh... what shape are the leaves again?
We found it! A mulberry bush!
Wait up there, speedy chefs. Gotta check everything is right.
translation.de: Einen Moment. Erst mal alles nachprüfen.

translation.en: Big and juicy, but not squishy?
Everything's exactly as the book says. Good job, Chefs.
translation.de: Alles wie im Buch. Gute Arbeit, Köche.

translation.en: ♪ Here we go round the mulberry bush Mulberry bush, mulberry bush ♪
translation.de: Wir laufen um den Maulbeerstrauch Maulbeerstrauch, Maulbeerstrauch

translation.en: ♪ Here we go round the mulberry bush On a warm and sunny morning ♪
translation.de: Wir laufen um den Maulbeerstrauch Am warmen, sonnigen Morgen

translation.en: Another order for the special dessert of the day.
Oh, I'm so excited to taste Mulberry Delight again.
translation.de: Ich freue mich so, endlich wieder Maulbeer-Traum zu essen.

translation.en: Time to mix up a whole lot of Mulberry Delight.
translation.de: Jetzt bereiten wir ganz viel Maulbeer-Traum zu.

translation.en: Thanks to Chefs Daisy and Cole,
we can serve up our favourite dessert at last.
Being chefs is super yummy fun! [giggles]
Can we have some more, please?
[Polly] You can have something even better.
